title: Email client/host updated (my domain), now all my messages are gone - can I get them back?
content:
Not sure how to explain this but...

I was using Bluehost, and they somehow screwed up my website (my email was attached to my domain). I switched domains today and when I restarted Thunderbird, all my previous emails disappeared. I'm not sure why they didn't stay on the "server" and I don't know how to get them back now that I've swtiched from Bluehost.


I still have access to my emails on my phone (thru gmail, not thunderbird, but it's NOT a gmail / Google Workspace email).

Is there a way for me to retrieve these messages? I'm on a mac, btw.
creator: kmh2800

title: How in the world is Thunderbird 5 revisions behind in the flatpak repo, i.e. 140?  But current version is 145?
content: How in the world is Thunderbird 5 revisions behind in the flatpak repo, i.e. 140? But current version is 145? Windows version is 145, but flakpak is only 140? REALLY FRUSTRATING when you are migrating from Windows to Linux and Thunderbird is way out of date! No wonder people don't like migrating to Linux. You make it truly painful! Documentation/website for Thunderbird states that flatpak always installs latest version? RIGHT, what a load of BS.

title: Thunderbird 145.0 pro Win nezobrazuje česká jména výchozích složek IMAP
content:
Po aktualizaci na verzi 145.0 (Windows) se přestaly zobrazovat jména výchozích IMAP složek v českém jazyce. Jedinná složka, která se zobrazuje v pořádku je "Doručená pošta" (sent). Zkoušel jsem přepnout Thunderbird na anglickou lokalizaci a poté zpět na českou ale bez úspěchu. Jednoduché přejmenování složek přes "vlastnosti" také nefunguje (název nelze editovat). Je možné nějak upravit lokalizaci nebo složky přejmenovat?

Zobrazený název -> Správný překlad: drafts -> Koncepty Templates -> Šablony sent -> Odeslaná pošta archive -> Archiv spam -> Spam trash -> Koš

<Eng> After updating to version 145.0 (Windows), the names of the default IMAP folders stopped displaying in Czech. The only folder that still displays correctly is “Doručená pošta” (Inbox). I tried switching Thunderbird to the English locale and then back to Czech, but without success. Simply renaming the folders via “Properties” also doesn’t work (the name can’t be edited). Is it possible to adjust the localization somehow or rename the folders?
creator: pavel.skoupy

title: I can't fetch the certificate in my account settings

Is there another way I can confirm the security exception?

title: Previously deleted emails are returning to InBox and unable to delete them
content: Over 4000 previously deleted emails suddenly started loading to my Inbox. I have tried to delete them but get a message - "Unable to write the email to the mailbox. Make sure the file system allows you write privileges, and you have enough disk space to copy the mailbox". There appears to be plenty of disk space and as far as I'm aware the file system allows write privileges as I am Administrator. I have managed to delete the messages using Up Function+Delete, (which doesn't write to the Delete folder), and have cleared all from Webmail but still have the same problem. I am also unable to receive any new emails. The email is POP3 configured. I have ensured that my Thunderbird if up to date. I operate Windows 10.

title: Streamlined workflow for signing PDFs
content:
Hi Everyone,

I am very excited about the new PDF signature feature in Thunderbird, awesome to not have to do this externally.

However, I am still trying to find a way to streamline a common workflow for me: I get a an email with pdfs attached where I need to insert signatures in a few places and send this back. My current workflow is the following: i open each pdf attachment, add the signature, save it to a file, and then open the email reply and reattach the correct files and all of them. It is this indirection via files that actually created the biggest headache for me, as it's a bit too easy to mess up here.

I also tried going via the "reply with attachments" extension, to have the reply email with all attachments already, but there seems to be no way to then edit them in thunderbird.

Am I missing something obvious for how to do this? Given that I am surely not the only one doing this, I am hoping someone has already figured this one out?

Antoine
creator: antoinek

title: Thunderbird op 2e PC installeren
content:
Geachte mevr.hr., Thunderbird 140,5,0esr staat bij mij op een PC met Windows10pro. Deze wil nu ook op een nieuwe laptop met Windows 11 home zetten. Ik heb een uitgebreide beschrijving gevolgd maar zonder succes. Op de nieuwe laptop heb ik als eerste dezelfde versieThunderbird geinstalleerd. (140,5,00esr) De map profiles heb ik vogens de beschrijving overgezet. Ik heb op de oude PC 2 profiles gevonden: "b5wd1fru.default-esr" en "csm24yem.default". Beide overgezet naar de nieuwe laptop. Omdat dit niet kon worden gevonden heb ik op de laptop even de toestand direct na installatie van Thunderbird (tijdelijk) hersteld. Het profile.ini op de nieuwe laptop ziet er als volgt uit:

[InstallD78BF5DD33499EC2] Default=Profiles/vbhzfrmo.default-esr Locked=1 [Profile1] Name=default IsRelative=1 Path=Profiles/y7flekot.default Default=1 [Profile0] Name=default-esr IsRelative=1 Path=Profiles/vbhzfrmo.default-esr [General] StartWithLastProfile=1 Version=2

En instal.ini ziet er als volgt uit: [D78BF5DD33499EC2] Default=Profiles/vbhzfrmo.default-esr Locked=1

Wat moet ik aanpassen om alles van de oudere PC ook op de nieuwe laptop terug te kunnen vinden? Eerst weer "b5wd1fru.default-esr" en "csm24yem.default" overzetten neem ik aan maar dan ..? Mijn dank voor uw antwoord(en)
creator: b.huijsdens1

title: Thunderbird Data file not opening
content: Hello, i am currently woking on an issue inside of the latest version of thunderbird. We have the data file for thunderbird located on the desktop. It shows as 37gb of data. however when we try to open the data file from inside of thunderbird. We cannot see any of the information from the folder. If i go all the was into the data file directory and select sub folders, they will open inside of thunderbird and show correct data. however, when i set thunderbird to open the entire directory with its sub folders, the application does not display any of the sub folders or information from inside the folders. We have attempted to go into properties and repair the file from inside thunderbird. It shows as 0kb file inside of thunderbird. it shows as a 37gb folder on the desktop. Once again to clarify, i can access specific directories inside the data folder but not the data folder as a whole. Any support or suggestions would be greatly appreciated. Thanks You

title: Cannot Send E-Mail through Mozilla Thunderbird
content:
Hello,

I've used Thunderbird for my e-mail for approximately 15 years, and now I can't currently send e-mail. I've gone through all the troubleshooting steps and also had Geek Squad attempt to fix it, but I'm still unable to send e-mail (I can receive them).

I've changed my password multiple times, reinstalled a fresh copy of Thunderbird on my Windows 11 laptop, restored the default settings for the outgoing server to align with what Verizon has specified, and nothing resolves the problem.

I keep getting the message: " Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: Email rejected. Please verify that your email address is correct in your account settings and try again."

Please let me know what the next step is so that I can use Thunderbird to send and receive my e-mails, like I have in the past.
creator: grod75
